intro: Spicanta lanceola, commonly known as the lanceolate spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, disturbed soils. It contains toxic compounds, including latex, which can cause skin irritation. Spicanta lanceola is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open habitats.
